distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage 1.3.3 that fixes one security issue, multiple bugs, and adds various enhancements is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat Ceph Storage is a scalable, open, software-defined storage platform that combines the most stable version of the Ceph storage system with a Ceph management platform, deployment utilities, and support services.

Security Fix(es):

* A flaw was found in Ceph RGW code which allows an anonymous user to list contents of RGW bucket by bypassing ACL which should only allow authenticated users to list contents of bucket. (CVE-2016-7031)

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Ceph Storage 1.3.3 Release Notes linked from the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in Ceph RGW code which allows an anonymous user to list contents of RGW bucket by bypassing ACL which should only allow authenticated users to list contents of bucket.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ceph: RGW permits bucket listing when authenticated_users=read
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ceph: RGW permits bucket listing when authenticated_users=read
